Articles.Content:
Made a separate download for just the Launch towers.

They are the same ones from FASA and have the same version numbers as the FASA change log so you know if its a newer version.

Now on Kerbal Stuff!!!

http://beta.kerbalstuff.com/mod/34/FASA_Launch_Clamps_and_Towers

MediaFire Mirror

http://www./download/1l58ram4eapm0oo/FASA_Clamps4.921.zip

Tutorial on how to build your own clamps.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76136-FASA-Launch-tower-tutorial?p=1083756#post1083756

The same launch towers and clamps from FASA, just by themselves.

Known Bug: The clamps following you into space, this is a KSP bug. If you quick save and reload right after decoupling the clamps it will fix it on the reload.

Also if you have exploding rockets on the pad with clamps this will help... http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55657-1-0-2-Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement-v3-1-3-4-27-15

Launch Tower- Lets Kerbals walk onto there rocket, if its shaking add some struts.

Umbilical - Keeps your rocket full of fuel and electricity on the pad

Atlas Clamp - Atlas style radial launch clamp

Mercury 2.5m stack clamp- Attaches to the bottom of your rocket, just like the real thing.

Mercury 1.25m stack clamp- Attaches to the bottom of your rocket, just like the real thing.

Apollo style launch clamp

I am using the launch clamp mechanic from the game meaning that the towers actually hold your rocket. So just like the launch clamps if you put them only on one side of a really tall rocket you will have issues!!!!
